answers.answer: I haven't personally but as long as you take care of yourself, exercise, eat well, cute back on sugars and startches you should be fine :-) as for vag delivery this is my opinion bc I disagree with doctors on this but with gd they get induction and csection happy bc omg your baby could possibly weigh a pound more than normal. So I would talk to your doctor and see what their thoughts and usual course of action with gd patients and stress that you want to try a natural birth. Also just a bit of info a baby is not considered 'big' until 9lbs14 oz. My mil had a 9.14 and my mother had a 10.3 and neither of them had gd. Lol good luck huny I Joe all guess we'll for you! :-)

I have GD as well.  I am now 37 weeks and everything is going well.  She was measuring a little bit bigger but is still on track for my due date.  One thing is the carbs! So if I eat a carby meal, I go for a 10 to 15 minutes walk at a brisk pace. It helps to bring my numbers down. My morning ones are always low because of the pill.my baby is healthy and kicking and rolling so it's not as bad as you might fear.

How high is it? Mine was always like 107-120. I started doing light exercise at night(2hour before bed with a night time snack) and/or carb restriction to like 25 g with atleast 10g of protein. I also take apple cidar vinegar (optional). My blood sugar is down to the 80's now.
The highest has been 113 for my fasting. Thanks ladies

question: I found at 27 weeks that I have gd.  My morning results are always out of range but through out the day it's in range. My new dr put me on a pill at night to help control my morning numbers. I'm so nervous about this. He told me gd can cause still birth, big babies, and diabetes later in life. I'm so scared I can't lose another  I want a unmedicated vag delivery.  Pray for me and my lil girl.  Has any one else ever goneed thru this. Stories please
title: help
